website_summaries.verdict: Just a great cleaner at a good price if you can deal with the comparatively small coverage area.
pros: Great hard surface cleaner on a budget
good sized water reservoir means more time cleaning and less time filling the tank
cons: instructions warn against using anything but Hoover cleaning products and those aren't cheap

customer_reviews.title: NOT recommended
customer_reviews.text: Please take your time and read the reviews on here. As others have found, the cleaner is great when it works, but sadly it has a very high failure rate. Ours lasted about 5 months before it wouldn't turn on. We took it into a Hoover repair center just over 2 months ago. They still have it.
customer_reviews.author: Kinga

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: Little over a year and it didn’t work. Opened it up thinking it was the switch. Here the hole motor is rusted tight. How does this happen?
customer_reviews.author: W.Bauer

customer_reviews.title: motor rusted in 4 months
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this unit in january 2016 and it stopped working in april 2016. it wouldn't turn on. i opened it up and the motor was all rusted out..see photo.
customer_reviews.author: Watchman

customer_reviews.title: Failed to start after 4 uses
customer_reviews.text: I used this product a total of 4 times in 2.5 years. I planned on using it today on my living room hardwood floor. I removed it from the original box,poured the recommended cleaning solution in the dispensing bin,attached it appropriately and plugged it in. I pushed the red start button and it failed to start. I plugged it into 2 other plugs in other rooms and verified I had not blown a fuse. I am very disappointed in this product and would expect it to last much longer than it did. Huge waste of money. BTW, the cleaning performance was ok but again not what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy J

customer_reviews.title: Updated model with 2 canisters not as good
customer_reviews.text: I prefer the older model this machine leaks all the time very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Naynayray

customer_reviews.title: It stinks
customer_reviews.text: It broke after 3 times using it. my choice is to mail it to Rochester NH. I get to pay freight both ways. After paying freight I suppose it will cost as much as the $ 84 floormate did. It is 5 months old. I am pissed and it stinks.
customer_reviews.author: Beauknows

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: Lasted only 4 months.... postage to return for warrenty is at CUSTOMER'S expense
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in June (2018) but not usable by October. the clean water leaks out faster than the machine can suck it up. The entire clean water tank leaks out before you to start the cleaning. Its not a crack in the water container - it's in the machine somewhere. Hoover warranty says I have to return the unit, by mail, AT MY EXPENSE, to have it replaced, so I do not consider this a good faith warranty. I should not be out any additional funds to have them fix/replace their defective unit. Taking it to a local store was not an option to have it replaced. Not a happy customer. Will not buy Hoover again.
customer_reviews.author: Jackiemce

customer_reviews.title: Rate it "ZERO!" It doesn't collect waste water dispersed on the floor after the "Wash" process.
customer_reviews.text: The current date is June 14, 2019. I ordered this item on March 19, 2018. I've never used it until today. It doethasn't work! Mea culpa (my fault) that I never used the Hoover Floormate until today. Based on my online research, this is apparently a common occurrence, but NOT on a brand new item! This is the second Hoover Floormate I've owned. I guess, I should have bought a different brand because I had that one for a number of years, but used it very infrequently...maybe once a year. I don't think that one should have failed. I think, I'll look at other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous FL

customer_reviews.title: Use before your return time is up!
customer_reviews.text: Finally had a big mess in the kitchen thanks to two girls trying to bake their first cake and tried using it for the first time and it does not work. No matter what we try we cannot get the cleaning solution come out. Tried all the troubleshooting suggestions for the manual. Think we got a bad unit, probably why it was returned the first time to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Motor will die on you.
customer_reviews.text: Pay attention to reviews of people who have had this machine over 6 months. Every time you knock it lightly against anything while carrying it, the brushes pop up and you have to touch that nastiness to pop them back in. It does clean very well when working. The motor will die on you somewhere between 6 and 18 months. It's always the same problem, you turn it on and it acts like it's going to turn on for a second, then the motor dies and will not restart. I had mine 14 months and now it's in the landfill. Only used it about once a week on debris-free floors.
customer_reviews.author: Sean and Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Website promises more than what is delivered.
customer_reviews.text: The video on the website indicates two brushes were included with the floor cleaner--one for tile and a softer one for hard wood floors. No hard wood floor brush was included, despite the fact that the owner's manual even showed 2 brushes for the FH40160 model. Apparently, Hoover, no longer provides the second brush and charges $36.85 plus $6.95 in shipping to get one. Eventually, Amazon made good by crediting my account for the purchase price of the second brush from Hoover but it took a lot of patience getting them to do that. Would not buy again. Hoover refused to publish my honest review on their website.
customer_reviews.author: Rocco T

customer_reviews.title: Leaks terribly. Leaks tons of water even when off.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the way this machine cleans, it really was impressive with the amount of dirty water it sucked up, but it is completely leaking when off. It makes a massive mess everywhere. I’ll be contacting Hoover. I used this right out of the box. Everything was secure so I don’t understand why it was leaking so badly. Hopefully this is not the norm, and not all machines are like this. Once I get more feedback, I’ll update the post.
customer_reviews.author: Extreme_D_CO

customer_reviews.title: This machine works for a short time 3 to 4 months MAX
customer_reviews.text: This was a great machine while it worked I should have listen to the reviews. The machine has warrenty but unless you live near their return adress its going to cost you the price of a new machine to Send the unit BACK! My machine started to leak out all the cleaning solution and it was covered and approved for replacent by hoover but they only want me to send it back to TN i live in MA that cost is from 88-130 dollars same price i paid for this machine. DONT WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY IT WILL BREAK DOWN.
customer_reviews.author: SFigs

customer_reviews.title: Another one for the bad motor crew
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two of these machines now and I'll never buy another. This one lasted exactly a year and it was lightly used. The first was similar, just over any warranty on. I put the first down to a fluke then after I'd purchased the second I started seeing reviews on motor failure. If you buy this product, you're playing the lottery. When it works, it's great but the machines need to work longer. The number of hours mine ran before failing was abysmal.
customer_reviews.author: Erin S. Contour

customer_reviews.title: I want to love it, but I DONT!
customer_reviews.text: I hate mopping so I was really hoping this would be amazing but it's not! Although, the dirty water side does get dirty, the vacuum actually makes the floors look filthy. Not sure if I got a lemon but floor never looks wet and water comes out when it wants even though I squeeze the handle over and over. I spent 45 mins cleaning and I still had 3/4 of clean water in the tank. Floors look terrible. I've read the instructions and watched multiple Youtube videos. Unless someone can give me a magic trick I'll be returning it. Ps it's almost as if the brushes dont actually reach the floor.
customer_reviews.author: B,D, & E

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money! We had an older floor mate that worked great but we wore it out so my wife ordered this as a replacement. Straight out of the box, this looks & feels much cheaper and the results bear out that impression. It simply does a lousy job on our tile floors. When washing, there’s very little water dispenser and the floor is still dirty after wash & vacuum. Don’t waste your time & money, you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: David Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Tile floors & I got Dogs
customer_reviews.text: Read the instructions so you know how to work this thing!! If your getting streaks or water leaking... Like alot of complaints I read in the reviews you are not using it correctly!! It does have a clean feature that just sucks water up. I love this feature for spills & dogs I can not believe the dirty water that I get up off my floors with this !! I don't have hardwood floors only tile floors And I have used the paws & claws solution & it works great as does just vinegar & water. I’m very pleased with the machine & my floors never looked better!!
customer_reviews.author: LAquilina

customer_reviews.title: Updated less than 2 months.  a warning this would be the second that had the power switch fail in less than 3 months. Stay away.
customer_reviews.text: Just a warning this would be the second that had the power switch fail in less than 3 months. It wasn't used every day. It wasn't cleaning up floods. Just clean a flat tile floor. Stay away from this item. Again this is the 2nd one that failed in less than 3 months. Update.... I took apart this thing to check it out. Switch is actually fine. The motor was frozen Solid and the fan was rusted out. This was never submerged so the rust on 'new' was shocking
customer_reviews.author: Jimbacca

customer_reviews.title: Bristles are coming out of brushes!  Cannot use!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this machine too many times over the years. I also mop, but use the Hoover Floormate once in awhile. I just used it today and then took off the brushes to clean them. Well all of the bristles are coming out as you can see in the pictures! I can't use this if all of the bristles are just going to fall out everywhere! I'm very disappointed. It must be poorly made if all of the bristles come out so easily. I guess I'll be getting rid of this machine and just sticking with a mop for the hard floors. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: S in AZ

customer_reviews.title: Worst Hoover product ever
customer_reviews.text: I have had two Floormates prior to this one. I just used it for the first time. It is a piece of junk. My old Floormate is on it’s last legs but it works better than this one. If I could return it, I would in a heartbeat. Total waste of money in my opinion. Doesn’t clean the tile, doesn’t pick up the smallest particle on the floor. Just useless.
customer_reviews.author: Susan V

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these floor scrubber cleaners in the last 26 months. The last one lasted only 10 months! Reading the majority of the reviews is what convinced me to re-purchase this machine. I was hoping the early demise of my first Floormate was just an anomaly. It WAS NOT. This new product lasted exactly 10 months. We used it only to clean the kitchen tile - about 80 square foot area. The motor & / or the starter button Hoover uses is a piece of trash. One day, out of the blue, it just doesn't turn on. Would never recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: J M Theno

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend  for Tile floors
customer_reviews.text: I have bought either the Hoover or the Bissell floor cleaner for the last 15 years or so. They both only last between 2 or 3 years and work the same. And for me it is worth the money. I have "to" many pets and a spouse with Parkinsons, the amount of time it saves me scrubbing and mopping is great and I don't have to hurt my back. It is lightweight and easy to move. Some say it leaks and yes it does But you have to know how to use it to work around the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Looking for quality

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I ever used a regular mop. The amount of dirt this thing sucks off my floors is amazing and disgusting! I sweep and still it pulls out lots of sand and grime. Being able to suck up the dirty water and is so great. I know my floors are clean after using this cleaner. I've used mops, steam mops and still my floors never got really clean. This does it. And it's easy. We have hardwoods in most of the house, laminate and tile in 2 rooms. This does not get the grout clean. Just the tiles. But that is fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisF

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this 2 years ago, and it worked great for about 1 year. Then it quit working well. It quit pushing water out and suctioning at the same time. Now each feature works separately but not together. I would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Good dollar value
customer_reviews.text: I had another Floormate that this one replaces. In light of other reviews, it’s interesting to note the old Floormate (which I inherited and do not know how old it was) was all rusted on the interior. This one does the job. I wish it had a bit more scrubbing power, because I have saltillo tile floors that are uneven surface and sometimes I have to push on the top of the machine to make the brushes have strong contact, but that’s probably more an issue with my floor than the machine. I also cleaned two area rugs and was shocked at how well they came clean. I think overall for the price, this is a good dollar value.
customer_reviews.author: Beach babe

customer_reviews.title: A wet mess
customer_reviews.text: I'm not happy with this floor cleaner at all. It leaves the floor soaking wet even when in "dry" mode. It is a mess and a hassle to deal with as there was water everywhere. Even after I unplugged it to empty the water bins and put it away, there was water dripping from it. I am in the process of returning it now. I am not sure if mine is defective or they are all just this messy.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. W

customer_reviews.title: Save your money; I am out $135 bucks. ...
customer_reviews.text: Save your money; I am out $135 bucks. The brushes do not hit the tile floor so you are basically pouring water onto the floor and soaking it up again. No scrubbing is taking place. I've tried it numerous times and the brushes are completely clean which is an indication that they are NOT hitting the floor. Took it to an authorized repair center who said it was "working as designed." Thought it was designed to "scrub" my floors; guess not!
customer_reviews.author: Kfred

customer_reviews.title: Major design flaw: motor develops an ear-splitting howl after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: When new, this machine is amazing. It scrubs and then dries tile floors, leaving them shiny and clean. However, after a few months, the suction starts to wane, and the motor starts making a shrieking sound. This gets louder with each use until it becomes ear-splitting and unbearable. I've had it repaired three times under warranty, and each time the motor only lasted a few months. I am now at the point in this endless cycle, that the machine, yet again, needs repair. Well, I'm done with it and will look for an alternative machine from another manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Joe777

customer_reviews.title: I had one prior to this and it worked wonderfully and like a soldier
customer_reviews.text: I had one prior to this and it worked wonderfully and like a soldier. This one "lasted" less than eight (8) months. I babied the other one and did so with this, as well. The first one had 5x the floor area to clean and did a remarkable job. The second now refuses to turn on. Changed outlets (tried three different outlets). Made sure tank reservoirs were full/empty (both conditions); there was no kink in the cord nor fraying. There is no "jam" nor foreign objects in the brushes. I used only mfg recommended cleaning agents. I am SORELY disappointed. Customer service recommended repair facility some distance away. Truly, truly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What is wrong with the start button that it does not work after a few uses.?????????
customer_reviews.text: I gave to my daughter, she used for about a month and it quit working. Luckily she told me in time and I was able to cut the cord and send the ID number back and they replaced it. I thought everything was good and now the start switch does not work again. What is wrong with this product that the start and stop minute button does not work. I need them to replace it again. Joanne Waffa. 954-993-3703 I sent a email to Hoover with no response. O 9/7/20 They apparently have a switch problem. I am very upset. Please help with this matter. Joanne Waffa.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne

customer_reviews.title: Leaked solution from the first use. didn't pick up liquid
customer_reviews.text: I filled the solution tank and went to go plug the unit in. 2 minutes later all the solution had leaked. Figuring I might as well use the solution i went ahead and scrubbed. When I turned the dial to pick up the liquid - it didn't pick anything up. I ended up having to mop by hand. Will return this to amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Mckinney

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased two of these in the last two and a half years. The first only lasted about twelve months and the second lasted for 18 months. I only use this machine once a week on Sundays for a small 800 square foot apartment with marble floors. So I was able to use it roughly 52 times for the first machine, and roughly 75 times for the second. When it works it works great, but both times the motor gave out and just they just stopped working. It’s a shame that these things aren’t built to last, especially with how little I used them. I wouldn’t recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Travis L.

customer_reviews.title: was great, now isn't
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this machine - I felt it cleaned the wood and tile floors very well and used it regularly. After 3 months, the gears failed and the brushes no longer spin to scrub the floors. I was used as directed on hard surfaces only. I called regarding a factory warranty and was told that the brush motor is not covered. I searched for a replacement motor assembly and was not successful in finding one. So it was a great tool and cleaned fabulously until approximately 5 months after purchase. If you are ok with a machine that lasts 5 months, this is the machine for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hoover no longer means quality
customer_reviews.text: Loved it AT FIRST! Yes, I was guilty of trusting the Hoover brand because of past purchases. Well...After 5 months of use, it began pouring water from the clean water/solution tank. I tried repositioning the tank and nothing helped. I checked and was using it according to the owner’s manual. Called Hoover support several times and they finally said they would swap it if I would pay shipping to TN. Since, I live in AZ it was going to cost about what I paid for it. I hated getting the old run around from their customer “service”, so I’m done with anything Hoover!
customer_reviews.author: AZMimi

customer_reviews.title: It WILL break sooner than later
customer_reviews.text: I loved this machine when it worked. But less than a year after purchasing it, and not using that much, the clean water tank started leaking onto the floor. I researched it and I found many people with the same leaking tank. I though I would just break down and buy a new tank. Surprise, they are not available. Hoover has been out of stock for a long time. I have read people's old posts on other sites that they could not get the part due to Hoover being out of stock. Really, find another floor cleaner and save yourself the heartbreak of a relatively new machine breaking down.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Dry Mode
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use for what it is. Nice long cord. Set up was easy. My only complaint is the dry mode. It does not suck up much water. I tried to go over and over the same spot and it still looked way too wet. It does pick up water because the dirty water tank fills up but the floor looked really wet. I had to go over the floor with a towel to get up excess water. Also, it does leave streaks. I may improve in my technique in the future.
customer_reviews.author: V. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: brushes Do not touch the tiles
customer_reviews.text: I loved that this item has the scrubbing brushes, perfect for my white tile and grout I thought. However the brushes in use do not even touch the tiles much less the grout I know this because I put my had under while running. I had huge hopes this was the floor cleaner for me, it did have great suction a nice long cord and that was about it.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Love this cleaner. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I had this tile cleaner for a few years and ended up giving it away because i moved into a carpeted condo. I now live in a house with tile again, and a dog. I loved this cleaner so much the first time, that i purchased it again. It is so easy to use and it is nice and lightweight. You think your floor looks pretty clean, then you use this and its like EEEWWW when you see what the dirty tank looks like. I have used this newer purchase twice for whole-house cleaning and numerous times for spot cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I am now obsessed with cleaning my floors. This is a great little machine for hard floors. I keep it filled and ready to go. When not in use, keep a towel under it while storing to absorb expected drips. Don't bother buying more of the cleaning solution that comes with it. Just use your own floor cleaning soap. The stuff that comes with it leaves a dull film.
customer_reviews.author: dws

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This is the second FloorMate Deluxe that I had and both broke within the year - Maybe used four times or so. Both broke the same way, hit the power button and nothing. Although it comes with a two year limited warranty, good luck getting anyone at Hoover to answer the phone. Fool me once...
customer_reviews.author: JSH

customer_reviews.title: The Single Best Hard Floor Cleaning In The World
customer_reviews.text: Really, my wife and I tried several different makes and models for our new tile floors. We had tile put throughout the house. The other models are designed for people who only have tile in bathrooms and/or kitchen. They have small reservoirs and will fill up and/or empty after 150 square feet. This baby has larger cleaner and pickup capacity making large jobs much easier. The scrubbers are stiffer, and do a better job at cleaning stuck on grime that any other machine. I have read these break down after a while, time will tell and I will update if it does. Either way, none of the other machines replace good old fashioned map and bucket. This one does.
customer_reviews.author: Like2Spend

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS P
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS P.O.S. Had to drive 50 miles one way for warranty repairs because a 2 bit nylon worm gear wore out. As soon as warranty was over; guess what, same worm gear wore out. And of course Hoover will not sell you the worm gear, but only the entire motor assembly that so happens to cost 50% of original cost of the unit. You will regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: I. Langford

customer_reviews.title: Broke in just over a year, previous model was better
customer_reviews.text: As reviews have said, the previous model was better. The brushes have stopped spinning, we took it apart and the plastic teeth that spin the rod that spin the brushes are worn off. Looking at different brands of hard floor cleaners. Unfortunately, there isn't a huge selection. Things that are out there do not have incredible reviews. No, don't waste your $140 on this unless you want to only use it a year.
customer_reviews.author: WithGODallthingsarepossible

customer_reviews.title: Loved how it worked until one day I plugged it ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in April. Loved how it worked until one day I plugged it in and it turned on for a split second and then died. Will no longer turn on. 3rd party and Amazon both will not do anything about it because its not within the 6 months of purchase. I was over by one month. I will try to reach hoover to see I have any options. If you buy I will send you good vibes that it will not fry on you like a lot of people on here have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Trust the bad reviews - I didn’t and now I’m warning you to keep shopping
customer_reviews.text: I should have trusted the other bad reviews... I didn’t and now after 6 total times using it I find myself warning others to do what I should have done - Do Not Buy This JUNK. After 6 uses it now no longer turns on. What a waste of money. I’m more mad at myself for ignoring reviews just like this one. Don’t find yourself in this position, it sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Niki

customer_reviews.title: Too Much Work
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try something new that may help clean the floors faster. There were alot of good reviews so I thought I would try it out. I hate it! takes longer to clean the floors, does not save time. Pros: -Cleans the floors well if nothing to scrub -Long Cord Cons: -Had some dried cat litter dust on laminate. Barely came up. -Constantly having to go over and over to pick up the water -Drips when trying to dry -Takes 3 times longer to clean the floors -Another machine that would take up room -The dirty water container does not click shut very well I will go back to what I like best. A spin mop by O-Cedar.
customer_reviews.author: Travis W.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we were looking for
customer_reviews.text: We have white tile and light grey grout that was VERY VERY discolored from previous owner's lack of cleaning beyond a swiffer wet mop. Since I have been using this floor scrubber, we have noticed layers of "grime and dirt" come up from both tile and grout. I agree with previous reviewers, the cleaner solution is not a miracle solution, but it does smell nice. Right now and for the foreseeable future I will continue to use vinegar and hot water to continue to cut through YEARS of build up. I am beyond happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and buy a Swiffer instead.
customer_reviews.text: I really REALLY regret buying this. Really. I should have believed the bad reviews on this. I had an older model and the ONLY reason I purchased this was because I could no longer buy the filters. Pros: it has a washable filler and it’s smaller and can fit into smaller areas. Cons: it simply does not clean. It doesn’t seem to put out the proper amount of water to clean. It’s very frustrating to spend over an hour cleaning the floors and the floors NOT be clean. Trust me when I say that you will regret buying this. Save your money and buy a Swiffer wet jet. Seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Milissa Browning

customer_reviews.title: Scrubs a tile floor and gets it clean
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these for many years because they scrub a tile floor. They last 2 years if u are lucky. I don’t know of another machine that adequately scrubs a tile floor. This model is inconsistent in the disbursement of washing solvent. It is noisy but it does clean the floor much better than a sponge mop.
customer_reviews.author: Smokey Simone

customer_reviews.title: Drying issues
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a few months now and used it several times. I have had issues with the "drying" function which can be concerning on wood or laminate flooring. This function does not have any suction power, so this leaves dirty water on the floor. I have tried several times to tinker around, going extremely slowly etc to male this drying suction work but I am still having issues. I will be contacting the manufacturer if this continues. I was very excited for this product, as it was hard to find an electric mop that had a separate reservoir for dirty/clean water but if it continues to malfunction it does not meet my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I like Floormate because if the bristle scrubber attachment. Had one and it conked out on me so thought I would try another big "B" brand. Well that one didn't scrub like the floormate, it was like running a paint roller over the roller. I immediately returned and re purchased the floormate and am much happier with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie A. Williams

customer_reviews.title: I would love it if . . .
customer_reviews.text: Although it will not clean grout for you, this is a great floor washer. I would give it five stars but for a trivial feature that isn't so trivial--the on/off switch. What idiot designed this one? The previous model had a standard switch that gave you on and off without difficulty. This one has a giant rubber cap on it that obscures off and on and when you press in the direction of either one, you get zilch for the first dozen tries. With an arthritic thumb, I find this more than mildly irritating, especially because I cannot figure out why anyone would do that to a switch.
customer_reviews.author: C. Pugh

customer_reviews.title: Power button stops working again.
customer_reviews.text: Ok owned the first one for 2 plus years and it all of a sudden power button wont turn on. Took a chance and bought one again, this time, 7 months and exact same problem. Hoover of course wants you to take to only a certified service center which is an hour away. Needless to say I will not buy any other Hoover product ever. Horrible customer service and obviously not well made. Sadly when it works it works great but when it quits working they really do not want to help the customer out and stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Karen VandenBosch

customer_reviews.title: Choose a different brand
customer_reviews.text: Received this product April 25. The motor burned up today. This is the second time I've had to replace one of these after only a few months of use. So disappointed
customer_reviews.author: JL bledsoe

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: My entire house is tile. I have three kids. — do I need to say more? I wanted something that wasn’t going to just push dirt around like a swiffer or steam mop. This is a sanity saver! It actually CLEANS the floor and the multi surface cleaner makes my house smell fresh and clean. I would recommend a million times over to anyone who would hear it. I love that my floor is dry immediately after using. It’s worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cleaner, poorly designed on off switch..
customer_reviews.text: This did a wonderful job on my tile floors. Easy-to-use, and really does a nice job even against baseboards and corners. The reason for only 4 stars is I hate the on off switch. It is a soft rubber rather than a switch and there multiple times that the switch wouldn't engage in order to turn on the machine and I had to push it 6 to 8 times to get it to stay on. Has this been a problem for anyone else or do I need to return mine?
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Baker

customer_reviews.title: Broke after two years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2016 and loved it. It got so much dirt from the ground. It didn't do great ton the grout of tile floors or with things really stuck to the floor but it got the general dirt clean very well. I especially loved it on my hardwood floors that have a crack between the boards because it got all the dirt out from the cracks. But after two years it stopped sucking up the water and I called customer service and they would not do anything because it was past its two year warranty. So great mop if it didn't break.
customer_reviews.author: Alysa Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Back Saver
customer_reviews.text: I have tile floors and a few laminate flooring throughout my home. I have always scrubbed my floors by hand but as I am getting older I cannot do this anymore. I have tried mops but they leave too much water on the floors. This machine is exactly what I was looking for. It scrubs the floors and sucks up the dirty water. The floors are safe to walk on in no time at all. It has nice suction, the water wells hold enough clean/dirty water, they are easy to change. I like the Hoover Tile and Grout cleaner and would recommend that as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS GARBAGE! I bought mine a little over 2 months ago. I ignored all the bad reviews because I needed something to clean my tile floors because my dog keeps peeing on them. I've used it maybe 7 times and went to use it today and the motor burned up. Amazon claims I've surpassed the return window so now I have to deal with Hoover to try to get my money back. I dont want a replacement as it leaves more water on the floor than it picks up. You would be better off mopping. Thanks for nothing amazon
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Great machine very well made.
customer_reviews.text: I have just received this machine today. Curious how this would work, easy to put together and easy to use. This machine is made very well. It is very easy to clean. The function is great and cleans my kitchen tiles great. On the other reviews claims this is not a great machine,so we shall see how this stands up to the other reviews. So far I think it is great. I used the tile and grout cleaner from Hoover. I think this machine will last a lot longer using the correct cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna

customer_reviews.title: Great cleaning machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd Hoover floormate ive purchased. The first one lasted 10 years with a lot of use so I’m hoping this one will too. This machine works just as well as the previous one perhaps better getting closer to edges. The solution tank is slightly bigger, I can clean my whole floor on 1 tank. The filter looks like it may be better as well. This machine is great on all SEALED flooring. It does a great job scrubbing up nearly anything and can be used as a vacuum as well. Easy to clean and empty.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job
customer_reviews.text: This floor scrubber does a good job on tile and it is not terribly noisy. There are a few design flaws. The on/off switch is inconveniently located and could be easier to find if the unit needs to be turned off quickly. The washing solution container will not stand by itself and is difficult to fill with water and washing solution because it must be held upright while filling. I suppose measuring the cleaning solution ahead of time so it is ready to pour into the container would help, but it would be so easy if this container stood on its own as the dirty water container does.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Archer

customer_reviews.title: Cleans beautifully and is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Have had the FloorMate Deluxe Hard Floor Cleaner for a month now and am very happy with it. My vinyl flooring (in 3 rooms) is textured (sorry I installed it) and is very hard to get clean. My back problems make it difficult for me to get down on the floor and scrub. Now I don't have to. So happy with how well it cleans and how nice my vinyl floors look. Works well on the tile floors (in 2 rooms) too.
customer_reviews.author: MysteryBuff

customer_reviews.title: IT DOES NOT CLEAN GROUT... maybe be useful otherwise, but only if you want to spent hours mopping your floor.
customer_reviews.text: If I wanted to spend hours and hours mopping my floors I would buy this item again. Instead I returned it. I definitely does not clean grout in tile. My floors were installed less than six months ago. The grout was sealed. The grout was moderately dirty. The bristles did not even touch the grout. I have to face it, I just have to scrub my grout with a brush. This is just not worth the time it takes. I much prefer squirt bottle and a flat mop with a microfiber pad on it. I spray the floor, mop it up, and rinse the pad in the sink regularly while mopping. This thing takes FOR-E-VER.
customer_reviews.author: bownut

customer_reviews.title: Newest model is very inferior
customer_reviews.text: I have had several Hoover Floormates in the past and recommended it over Bissell. So i bought the newest version and I am terribly disappointed. Very little water comes out, and the redesigned lever is ergonomically unfriendly to these old hands. I will see if i can do something to get the water to flow better but if not it gets returned. Sorry Hoover, not good this time. I wonder if the company was sold to China as a wonderful product is now piece of --
customer_reviews.author: Castleriggpekes

customer_reviews.title: Noooope!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this so much because I've heard that for some it works great. However, it scratched our hardwood floors so bad. We had our floors redone in 2017 and now before we sale this house we will have to have them resealed due to the damage this machine did. I would say this is NOT for real hardwood floors. Maybe great for tile. I would have only done 1 star but they refunded me without making me return the item, therefore I'm giving them an extra star for that. Customer service was good.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: Terrific product, but doesn't seem to last very long.
customer_reviews.text: It is 6 days past the 2 year warranty and when I went to use it today, the 'sucker' hose was broken nearly in half. I don't use it a huge amount and I'm not rough with it. The break happened right at the joint where the handle bends from the body, so it looks like a design failure. Overall, I love the thing, but I can't afford to relate a $140 machine every 2 years. I'm going to take it apart tomorrow to see if I can get that hose out and replace/fix it, but I will admit to being a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed; great concept that needs more engineering work
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to have the clean water & dirty water tanks separate as classic mopping is just moving dirty water around on the floor. Great concept that needs more engineering work. I also have a very large kitchen and it would take 2-3 refills of the water/solution in order to finish the floor. On the 3rd time using the machine, it would not release water/solution right away. It took a few minutes. I was fearful that the sprayer was already clogged. I returned the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Leaves your feet with black dye

customer_reviews.title: Great Mop for picking up the dirty water!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs and was curious on how well this mop would work. Things I love: - Picks up the gross water making the cleaning go much faster - There is a separate container for clean and dirty water - There is less drying time - Little scrubbers on the mop bottom do a good job on the dried mud Things they could improve: - This does not reach the grout to scrub it - I am not sure if I can use my standard cleaning products or only products designed specifically for this machine Pro-tip: buy a long handled grout brush and use in conjunction with this mop. You will get great results that way.
customer_reviews.author: Toddlertwinmama

customer_reviews.title: No mops and buckets!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my second Hoover FloorMate because my son had left very dirty water in the tank for over a week. I just can't get that smell out as would be the case with any other type product regardless. I knew Amazon would have my original order so, I could easily find the same model. It was 2014 when I first received my FloorMate. And, it was working just as it was brand new 6 years later!! Replacing only due to operator error. Our entire house is tile and hard wood so, it is an amazing value for this type cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: shopper1

customer_reviews.title: Works for everyday/weekly cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on our tile floors for daily or weekly cleaning, depending on the season, and was easy to use during its first year of use. However, I gave it to my father to use on his floors because he has small dogs and a cat and the spraying feature stopped working today after only being used by him for a year. I didn't see any hair clogs when I inspected it but there wasn't any. It may be a pump issue but the warranty is apparently up so we're going to try another machine that specifies for use in home with pets.
customer_reviews.author: Misty S

customer_reviews.title: The unit will not last longer than 11 mp than before breaking down.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th unit not including the cordless Hoover I purchased. I’ll begin by saying the unit works wonders on my tile floors and has saved me hours of time from mopping the traditional way however, each of the units have lasted about a year then the hose at the bottom of the unit cracks and the unit no longer has suction. I’ve contactEd Hoover and was told that their is no fix for this problem. I took the unit to a repair store and was given a quote to fix the unit that was nearly half as much as the original cost.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Maas

customer_reviews.title: Works grear, hope it holds up for years
customer_reviews.text: Used it 3 times. Easy to use and clean up. Definitely cleans better than a mop! We mop weekly and the water was still very dirty. Was not expecting that. We did not see any major difference in the grout color after we got done. Just know that it definitely cleaned our floors from the dirty water. We used the included soap and one that we purchased. Did not notice any real difference as far as lightening up the grout lines in the type of cleaning detergent used. Would definitely recommend for its ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Hoover FloorMate in January of 2016 and was quite thrilled that is worked so well. My excitement was short-lived, however. It appears that the hose that carries the water from the floor back to the unit has split. I contacted Hoover asking if I could purchase the part and was told the part was no longer manufactured! So, in other words, cannot be fixed! Very disappointing -- I would not consider buying this brand again!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia McCabe

customer_reviews.title: Horrible and will ruin floors
customer_reviews.text: SO I bought this one to replace the older version that had died on me, I loved the older one!! I hate this one, it leaks water/cleaner everywhere, doesnt suck up the liquids properly and has now ruined my wood floors cause I was unaware that it was leaking. Every time we use it we end up having to use bath towels to dry the floors! Horrible purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase this product.
customer_reviews.text: The reason for the low rating is this product is only 8 months old and quit working and hasn't been used that much. I used it to clean my hardwood floors and it did a decent job. During the middle of using the sound/pitch of the cleaner got higher and the water flow increased significantly. The suction quit and i had to mop the excess water up. This is the same issue with the first product i had however the first one lasted much longer. I will not be purchasing another hoover. I do believe twice is enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Great while it worked. Dead after a dozen uses. Used it only for deep cleans every few months and 2 years in it was completely dead.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: I have mostly hardwood but grew up cleaning carpet so this is great. I vacuum/Swifter and then can quickly and easily ...
customer_reviews.text: I am mildly obsessed with this thing! My friends/family have all heard about it. I have mostly hardwood but grew up cleaning carpet so this is great. I vacuum/Swifter and then can quickly and easily mop my floors this way. So much cleaner than sponge or traditional mop! And better than my old on the hands and knees with Murphys Oil Soap water. This product reminds me of a Bissell spot carpet cleaner except huge and vacuum like. I wish I had affiliate links because at least 3 of my friends have purchased this too... It's easy to clean out, I don't feel like mine is getting gross just yet.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Baumgart

customer_reviews.title: Not very wide and drippy
customer_reviews.text: This does a fine job of actually cleaning the floor, although it doesn’t get into the grout lines. I bought it for some non-slip tile we recently put in the bedroom which can’t be cleaned with microfiber or cotton mops due to the rough surface. It’s easy to fill and empty, but I don’t seem to be able to get the floor suctioned without getting new drips all over. When I’m done, unless I lift it into a container before heading to the laundry sink, it drips all over the house! I’m giving it one more try, before I decide to keep or pass.
customer_reviews.author: Debra H

customer_reviews.title: Not what Floormate use to be
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 3 Floormates over the last 15 years. My husband use to tell me I should be a spokeswoman for Floormate because I raved about how wonderful they were. Well, no more. Instead of 6 brushes, there is only 4. It doesn't dispense product as well as it use to and it doesn't suction the water off the floor as well either. The on/off switch is in an awkward place in stead of on the handle. The clean boost button is extremely hard to push and I can't tell any difference as to what it's purpose is. I have 2800 sq ft of ceramic flooring and now it's twice as hard to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda J. Rodden

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful cleaner!!!  Buy the warranty...
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product that actually CLEANS! There is no other product like this that has a soap tank, scrub brushes and a dirt tank... many look-alikes but only one floormate. Yes, they break. I buy one about every two years. But this time I bought the three-year warranty so I will get at least ONE free one! But for $150 what do you want? I clean the floors about a 500 times per machine... Hoover continues to improve the design. I hope they keep making this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: B. L. Friberg

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this. I bought it and used a few times and it just died. Called Hoover and they were great in sending a replacement. Now the replacement has died. I have only used both of them maybe a total of 4-5 times each before they just died.
customer_reviews.author: Rose E

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money! The Floormate is garbage. Have had 3 of them in the past year and if you get 6 months use out of them you're doing good. Hoover doesn't care that their product is poorly built. They either won't spray, won't pick up the dirty water, or the motor dies after a couple of months. The idea behind the Floormate is good but the actual product is not. Don't waste your money - look at one of the Bissell products instead.
customer_reviews.author: Wrajax

customer_reviews.title: Best thing EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I will buy and re buy this thing! It's my 2nd. The first one got abused. Cleaner and dirty water always got left in it and the seals heals up. 2000sf of hardwood and tile and it kicked butt the whole time. I have 2 teenage boys that are messy and it sucked up everything they dropped! With 2 dogs it got all the missed hair from sweeping. 7 years the first one ran with no issues and abuse. This one we will be kinder to haha. But I love it! No streaks, no pooling water, no mops, no back breaking floor cleaning. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: imablank

customer_reviews.title: terrible product
customer_reviews.text: this product does not last. I have had mine for probably 5 months and have used it at most 10 times as we split time between 2 homes in different states . Come home today and wanted to do a thorough job on the floors as I have dogs. Plugged it in and smelled the burnt motor. I am very disappointed in this . I will never waste money on a hoover product again
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Piece. of. C.R.A.P.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a piece of junk. I am planning to return to Amazon because no one at Hoover.com will respond to my emails and no one will answer their customer service line. The spinner brushes do not make contact with the floor and it just leaves water all over the place. Odd thing is, the suction seems fine, but it does a very poor job of suctioning up the wet puddles it leaves all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these machines several times because they are the only ones that wash, rinse and extracts the dirty water M. All other machines have rollers which wash the floor w the same dirty water. Not good when you’re trying to housebreak foster dogs. HOWEVER, THIS ONE ONLY LASTED A FEW MONTHS. Thankfully, it was covered under the manufacturer’s warranty. Get the extended insurance because the motors usually only last two years.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: AVOID!  Product customer support makes it not worth buying!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Hoover floormate. When the first one died I was encouraged by product updates to buy a new one. At less than 2 years, still in warranty, the brushes on the new one failed. After 30 minutes on hold for Hoover Customer service, performing multiple tests for the rep, I was told to send them the receipt and they would replace it. After doing ALL THAT I received an email that I had to send them the broken one and if I was lucky, wait a couple of weeks before they decided whether to replace it. I'm so done with Hoover!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: nancy baird

customer_reviews.title: Not what it used to be didn’t even last 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Well I loved the machine but very upset because I haven’t used it all that much and now it leaks like crazy. I owned the same machine many years ago and it was great this machine is a great concept but if it starts leaking before you have even finished the sample floor cleaners thT is really poor quality Update tried using again boredom from corona shelter in place 5/12/20 it apparently went on fire started smoking what a waste of money I am so discouraged and dissatisfied with wasting my money on something I thought would make my life easier
customer_reviews.author: JENNIFER CAPURSO

customer_reviews.title: Motor failed after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: The power button stopped working. I'm a mechanical engineer so I took it apart to see what was wrong with it. Motor was gone. Switch was good. Manufacturer cheaper out and didnt have the components of the motor electro plated and this is causing the unit to fail. I also work in electroplating and this is a 50c at most option for this motor and assembly. It is sad to see cost reductions like this. Dont buy this unit.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnathan Murphy

customer_reviews.title: it was kind of fun to see it work
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my maid, and she tried it out once and never used it afterward, preferring a regular mop. I also tried it out, it was kind of fun to see it work. Probably the best use for this is to do the same small area a few times a week without having to get out a bucket and supplies every time. For cleaning large areas once a week, just not as efficient as a manual mop and bucket.
customer_reviews.author: Sresq

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed it's smaller than the previous generation
customer_reviews.text: After a few years, my previous floor mate just stopped delivering water to the floor... looks like a simple kink in the hose that I may try to repair at some point. Ordered this new one because the floors need cleaned now - a little disappointed to see it is narrower than the previous model. Seemed to work well so far - the reviews have me a little nervous as to reliability - time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Web Geek

customer_reviews.title: Smaller cleaning path tha floormate.
customer_reviews.text: Hoover put the larger tanks on this model that the Floormate I bought previously. For me, with the 12 inch instead of 14 inch cleaning path negates the improvements for a larger house. The old floormate 14 inch also would vacuum the the water without having to switch to dry mode. I did not work out for me as a time and back saving device. If they had left the 14 inch cleaning path and had a dry mode in addition to to suction during operation on wash, then, I would have liked the machine.
customer_reviews.author: William W.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love it, I really did. I have a wrist injury, so I wanted something that would clean my floors like I've gotten down on my hands and knees with a scrub brush (my floors get mopped regularly, but deep cleaning happens 1-2x/year). This isn't it. If you're looking for something that will work as well as a sponge mop and dry your floors, this is it. The scrubbing brushes don't get down into crevices in the floor. I also used the grout and tile formula on my tile floors, and it didn't get the grout clean, even after going over the area a couple of times. Sorry Hoover, this one's getting returned.
customer_reviews.author: E. R. Hagen

customer_reviews.title: Comes with only 1 soft brush
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased this machine in the past and it came with 2 brushes: one for wood floors and one for tile. This machine came with only a single soft brush. I've called Hoover twice, asking how to purchase the "grout and tile" brush and they told me that that it's on a "long term back order" (?) It's not available at any website. So now I have a machine that won't effectively clean my tile floors and grout. The box went out in last week's garbage so I can't return it. Big wast of money. Hoover Customer Service was sooo long on hold, then they disconnected me. Ugghhhh
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Harfosh

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been?
customer_reviews.text: Before this purchase I thought I was cleaning my hardwood floors. But then I bought this Hoover Floormate on the recommendation of my sister. I was embarrassed to see the very dark water in the waste tank after a few swipes. This is a must for anyone with hardwood floors. It even has a simple method of sucking up any remaining moisture. It's my new toy. How did I go all these years in this old house without it? I Highly Recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Konishiwa

customer_reviews.title: Really Great Clean Machine
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Hoover FloorMate. This newer model replaced my old one which I totally wore out. Hoover makes the best floor cleaner. It has a great brush system, is easy to clean, and has terrific suction for picking up the water on the floor. It maneuvers easily and has a low profile so it can get underneath the cabinets. So many of these floor cleaning machines do not have great power, but the Hoover does.
customer_reviews.author: E. Sloane

customer_reviews.title: failed like everybody elses
customer_reviews.text: bought one few years ago and it was working great until it stopped working. then i gave another shot buy buying another one back in late last year. used it maybe 15 times since purchase and like everyone else say on the review. it stopped working and now i'm hesitant to purchase another one. will not recommend this to anybody until they solve this problem
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Chao

customer_reviews.title: I am amazed!
customer_reviews.text: My floors have never been so clean! I am amazed. The color of the water that came out of my kitchen floor was BLACK! I used to clean my kitchen regularly with the wet-jet but this is something else. In addition, doing my hardwood was a breeze, It had hidden dust, almost clay coming out of the floors when I opened the reservoir. Again, I am amazed! I love this Hoover and very happy with the purchase. Keep in mind it is a little heavy and loud, but manageable for a petite person like me.
customer_reviews.author: Malattar

customer_reviews.title: so far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I've just used it once so far really but so far so good. I had borrowed a Clarke machine from a friend (that one costs over $1000). The Clarke machine is much more heavy duty for sure but this one is actually a little easier to use. So far I have used it on tile mostly but I did also use it on a small area of glued down solid teak hardwood floor adjacent to my tile. I just used the same fluid and brushes and it cleaned up the wood ok. I'm using some carpet shampoo because I had it around and it seems to work (cleans without making foam in the receiver bottle.)
customer_reviews.author: TX gadget nutTop Contributor: Smart Home

product_meta.title: Hoover FH40160PC FloorMate Deluxe Hard Floor Cleaner, Wet Dry Vacuum, Silver
product_meta.description: Style Name:Floormate DeluxeThe FloorMate Deluxe Hard Floor Cleaner delivers a deep clean while gently and safely scrubbing sealed hardwood, vinyl, ceramic tile, laminate and marble floor surfaces. With the Dual Tank Technology and specialty brushes for wood, tile & grout you can have a deluxe clean anywhere you need it.
feature_bullets: SpinScrub Brush Technology - Patented 360° counter-rotating, removable brushes gently wash and scrub sealed wood, vinyl, tile and grout from all angles
Dual tank technology - Separates clean and dirty water so you can easily fill, empty, and rinse
Wash & dry mode selector – Wash with brushes and solution then switch to dry only to remove any excess water
Clean surge control - Easily applies extra detergent to stains and heavy traffic areas
